# format(_:)

**Instance Method**

Formats an integer, using this style.

## Declaration

```swift
func format(_ value: Value) -> String
```

## Parameters

- **value**: The integer to format.

## Return Value

A string representation of `value`, formatted according to the style’s configuration.

## Discussion

Use this method when you want to create a single style instance, and then use it to format multiple integers. To format a single integer, use the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/BinaryInteger] instance method [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/BinaryInteger/formatted(_:)-4qd73], passing in an instance of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/IntegerFormatStyle/Currency], or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/BinaryInteger/formatted()] to use a default style.
